instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Came in today for "wont turn on"

Tried iit nothing happens,. Open back and battery looks swollen., remove battery and pop in new one,. Works perfectly, but slow due to 2gb ram only,. so I upgrade the RAM.

Boots fine runs fine but I notice Pink tinting to screen and slight graphics glitches souse Medusa to to kill AMD and remove <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR>. Machine boots fine and only showinng Intel chip. I update OS and check battery is charging ok all is good so shut it down,. 

Come back to it today to test before giving it back and It wont power on. All I get is a quater fan spin endless loop.,

Ive tried evreything I can still no dice, 

Board alone on the desk nothing connected just the original 2gb ram I get constant quater fan spin loop and following Big coil voltages,


L7220 - Pulses on fan spin
L7260 - Solid 3.33v
L7550,L7510,L7520,L7530 all 0v
L7030 Solid 12.55v
l7630 Pulses
L9510 - 0v
L7330 Pulses

Any ideas dude?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Did you try SMC bypass mode?
Be sure to use original 85W Magsafe 1 charger.

Be aware of PRAM reset; in such case, need to reflash BIOS with Medusa, to disable GPU again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Smc bypass gives full fan spin but no boot.
I only use original 85 watt on the bench since my previous fuck ups.

Concerned about pram I've reset and even reflashed the bios with 2 known good bios files, and disabled gpu with medusa same outcome

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
"Smc bypass gives full fan spin but no boot."
Do you mean the board stays on, but no activity.
In such case, there is a problem with some SMC sensor (current, or voltage); check pages 48 & 49.
Once find that, maybe get activity too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
In SMC Bypass I get high fan spin that stays on but no chime , no screen on and no activity. 

Whats the best way to check and measure these dude, Should I go through each of these sensors checking for voltage going in and back out or should I be checking all the resistors to see if the values  match the schematic or both?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Just check sensors output voltage.
Like <CAPACITOR>C5304</CAPACITOR>/08/14/27, etc...

Started to feel a little lost when getting so many 0v readings, 

Doing this with board alone on desk and magsafe connected so getting constant quater fan spin as I measure,


<CAPACITOR>C5304</CAPACITOR> -2.08v
<CAPACITOR>C5308</CAPACITOR> - 0v

This mean anything to you,  I'm guessing a Vcore sensor looking at the svchem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: You must check when board is on; start it in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
" <CAPACITOR>C5327</CAPACITOR> - 4.1MV"
What this means?
I doubt you gan get Megavolt there!
So, is that 4.1V, or 4.1mV (milivolt)???

4.1V is far to high.
If is the case, check <RESISTOR>R5323</RESISTOR>/24 and their traces to <RESISTOR>R7640</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Pmsl. 
 Sorry dude 
 Just got back from a long day in the cold visiting santa with my lunatic kid! 

MV = milivolt

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
M=Mega, so be aware about the notations!
m=mili...

Basically nothing. sorry for the confusion,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Still quarter fan spin if remove the RAM module?
Is <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Still quarter fan spin is remove the RAM module? Yes was one of the first things I tried, no ram and different Ram modules, 

Is <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> present? Yes 3.28v
